intro: Lissochilus jumelleanus, commonly known as the Jumellean's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, often fragrant floral structures. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually small to medium-sized, with a distinctive coloration that ranges from white to pale pink. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
